title: Bodoni Flair Typeface?
content:
Hey everyone,

I'm in the middle of a project and came across some older type sheets I inherited from a friend. I've been searching the net frantically for a typeface/font version of Bodoni Flair but can't seem to find one. Would anyone happen to know where I could purchase this file in the electronic form?

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bodoni_flair_5096.jpg)
author: feldhouse

comments.content: [DF Miserichordia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000222) has a similar feel (at first glance.) As does [Perla](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=ALT0000144). Hmm, and [Bodoni Classic Swashes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/wiescher/bodoni_classic_swashes/). But nothing exactly the same...of which I am aware.
Thanks for the links. I haven't seen the Miserichordia one so I might take a further look at that. I appreciate the help!

What kind of world are we living in where a typeface as sweet as Bodoni Flair is not available digitally?  
Maybe someday...  
In the meantime, here's some other similar possibilities:

[Pink Mouse](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/pink-mouse/)

[Jojo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/jojo/)

[Omaha Bazoo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/omaha-bazoo-nf/)

[Groovy Happening](http://web.archive.org/web/20150225214701/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/groovy-happening/)

If you do a search on MyFonts.com for "1960s" you'll find a long list of trippy goodness.

Rob
